We can write a three digit number abc (i: We can write a three digit number abc (imagine it is as big as possible, so a≥b≥c) as 100×a + 10×b + c. If we rearrange the digits to make it as small as possible it would be cba which we can write as 100×c + 10×b + a. We then subtract to give 100×a + 10×b + c - (100×c + 10×b + a) = 99×a - 99×c = 99×(a - c). So after one step, the number will be a multiple of 99. The only 3 digit numbers that are multiples of 99 are 099, 198, 297, 396, 495, 594, 693, 792, 891, and 990.
